knimeNode.name: Database Sampling
knimeNode.shortDescription: The Database Sampling creates a SQL statement that allows to sample (a bunch of rows) from a database table

fullDescription.intro: This node extracts a sample (a bunch of rows) from the input data of a database. The dialog enables you to specify the sample size. The following options are available in the dialog:
fullDescription.option: Specify the absolute number of rows in the sample. If there are less rows than specified here, all rows are used.
The percentage of the number of rows in the sample. Must be between 0 and 100, inclusively.
This mode selects the top most rows of the table. Note that this depends on the implementation of the connected database.
Random sampling of all rows if connected database will support random sampling. Note that this method might be very slow for large database tables.
Check this button if you want stratified sampling, i.e. the distribution of values in the selected column is (approximately) retained in the output table.

ports.inPort: Table in database to apply database sampling
ports.outPort: Table in the database with sampled rows
